intro: Ornithogalum minor, commonly known as the lesser star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb with a short, thick rhizome and produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and blooms in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it prefers well-drained soil in full sun or partial shade. Ornithogalum minor is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
